column28: The reson why Plant Biosynthesis miRNA has better stability：2’-Omethylation at the 30 end is a key step in the maturation of plant miRNAs and has a protective effect on miRNA stability. Additionally, methylation at the miRNA 30 end makes it resistant to periodate oxidation and prevents degradation by nuclease digestion and erosion in mammals, thus extending its half-life in body fluids. Furthermore, 20-modification can prevent recognition by innate immune receptors and limit off-target effects due to suppression of partially complementary pairing. On the other hand, the crude extraction used in the reagent-free method may preserve some unknown components that enhance the stability of sRNA and facilitate its uptake by pests.
